result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique D. Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dominique D. Bryant is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dominique D. Bryant was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Atty Carl Johnson reported back to the court that the PD's office does not typically appoint counsel on this type of request.  Discussion ensues.  Deft contends he was not awarded 254 days of credit in this case (15CF688).  Credit of 254 days was awarded on the deft's other file 16CF51 on the 9mos WSP sentence.  In addition, the credit was not allowed on 15CF688 since the sentences were consecutive.  Deft's motion is denied.
Clerk Lema sent an email to Atty Carl Johnson (Kenosha PD's office); he is out of the office until 6/24/19.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DDA Gabriele appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Case brought to court on the deft's motion to amend the JOC and for sentence credit.  Brief discussion held.  Deft was informed that both the State and the minutes from CCAP reflect the sentences were consecutive; in addition, he was given the 254 days of sentence on 16CF51.  Court informed the deft the court reporter checked her notes & her audio recording - sentence was consecutive.  Court reporter filed a corrected sentencing transcript on 6/10/19.  Court requested the court clerk to reach out to the PD's office to see if an atty can speak with the deft regarding any recourse he may have regarding this issue.  Another TC set for 7/18/19 @ 2pm.

Minutes:  15CF688/16CF51.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Brian Hagner appeared via telephone.  Court unable to reach deft via telephone - would not come out of his cell.  Court asks Atty Brian Hagner, w/in 2wks from January 23rd, to send a letter to the deft with a copy to the Court and the State outlining what is contained in Atty Ehmann's letter and having the deft the sign off on the letter.  If deft will not sign off the letter, the Court will request the clerk to contact the prison to see if there is someone that can read the letter to the deft.  Upon completion of said task, the Court will grant Atty Hagner's motion to withdraw.

records.addlTxt: 9yrs WSP; initial appearance 4yrs followed by 5yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  DDA Graveley appeared during defense counsel's sentencing arguments.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

16CF51 - deft sentenced to 9mos WSP.  Credit for 254 days.  Any balance of credit shall be applied towards 15CF688.  Costs rolled into sentence.   

15CF688 - deft sentenced to 9yrs WSP consec to 16CF51; initial confinement of 4yrs followed by 5yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DNA ordered; notice given deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
Amended
Deft's Motion in Limine Regarding Testimony on Credibility of Witnesses

Minutes:  15CF688/16CF51.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Defense counsel reports the deft wishes to have her w/draw as counsel.  Discussion held.  Motion to w/draw is denied.  Court conducts colliquey with deft regarding whether he wanted to proceed to trial or accept the plea offer; during the colliquey, Court finds the deft willfully misled the Court.  Deft found in contempt; no sanction imposed - deft lectured by the Court.  Court takes a short recess to allow the deft and defense counsel to confer.  Court reconvenes.  Defense counsel reports the cases are settled.

15CF688 - Amended information filed.  Deft pleads no contest to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

16CF51 - Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge of battery; found guilty by the Court.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing hrg set for 3/18/16 @ 9:30am

Minutes:  15CF688/16CF51.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Defense requests an adjournment; Atty Caspari reports the deft is requesting more time to decide on whether he wishes to accept the plea or proceed to trial.  FPT set for 2/10/16 @ 1:15pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Defense requests JS date.  Oral demand made for speedy trial.  FPT set for 2/5/16 @ 11am, JS 2/15/16 @ 9am.  Atty Caspari reports she may be filing a motion; if motion is filed - will be heard at the FPT date on 2/5/16 @ 11am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Atty Caspari has now been appointed as counsel.  Atty Caspari reports there may be a potential conflict with her representation.  Two alibi witnesses in this case are also alibi witnesses in another case of hers; however, the cases are not related in any way.  Court doesn't believe there is a conflict but suggests Atty Caspari contact the Ethics Board.  Deft withdraws his speedy trial demand.  FPT set for 12/4/15 @ 10:30am.  ADA Krejcarek will have DDA Graveley's assistant email Clerk Lehman and defense counsel potential trial dates.
Atty:  D Caspari.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Breitenbach.  Defense moves to withdraw as counsel again for the reasons set forth on the record.  Deft concurs with the motion to withdraw.  Discussion also ensues regarding late disclosure of two witnesses from the State.  Brief discussion held with regard to the Fire Dept records for Theopera F.  State to prepare an order which orders which conforms with the CFR ordering the Fire Dept to release the medical records of Theopera F.  Court will allow Atty Breitenbach to withdraw.  Status set for 10/30/15 @ 11am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Breitenbach.  Brief discussion held on on whether the deft wishes to accept the plea offer; court takes a short recess to allow parties to confer.  Court reconvenes.  Deft does not wish to accept the plea offer.  Leave on for JS for next 10/19/15 @ 9am.  Amended information which was filed today is now w/drawn by the State.
State's Amended List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery

Minutes:  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.  State's other acts motion.  Arguments heard.  Court withholds a decision on the other acts motion until it is brought up in trial.  Court takes a short recess to allow Atty Breitenbach to confer w/his client regarding a revised offer.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Court reconvenes.  Deft requests add'l time to think over offer.  FPT set for 10/12/15 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jerold Breitenbach.  Defense counsel notes he has not received the State's motion for other acts; copy provided to defense counsel in court today.  MH/FPT adj to 10/8/15 @ 2:30pm.

Defendant Dominique D. Bryant appeared with Attorney Jerold William Breitenbach. Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Testimony from State's witness: KPD Detective J. Kenesie; Defense witness: Rakiya P.. ST moves for bind over; probable cause found, case bound over to Br 3. Pleas of Not Guilty entered. Information filed, reading waived. Speedy trial demand. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Atty  J Breitenbach.

*No Weapons.   *No Contact w/ Theopera F Jr, Sherise H, William W, James H, Donte B, their residences.
